Description: Lip and wall sherd of East Greek (North Ionian) black-figured pottery bowl; interior: streaky brown with two red bands lined in white; exterior: cream slip; lion (head turned back) attacking a bull (only part of the bull's head preserved) with its raised right foreleg; red patches on legs of lion; incision used for details of lion and of bull; filling ornaments: blobs and dotted circle; band with added red band lined in white below.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XIII, no. 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.273)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (no. 1011, pl. 111)
